GrowthStages.Seedling: Small rosette with deeply lobed leaves
GrowthStages.Mature: Full rosette with hollow flower stems

Message: This is a common perennial lawn weed found worldwide.
ControlMeasure: Can be removed by digging out the taproot. Herbicides containing 2,4-D are effective. Best controlled in fall when nutrients move to roots.
Climate: Grows in temperate climates worldwide, very adaptable to various soil conditions.
AdditionalInfo: Despite being a weed, dandelions have edible parts and medicinal properties. Rich in vitamins A, C, and K.
IdentificationTips: Deeply lobed leaves, hollow stems, milky sap, yellow flowers

Message: This is an invasive grass weed.
ControlMeasure: Pre-emergent herbicides in spring, or pull manually while young.
AdditionalInfo: Annual grass that spreads via seeds and can quickly take over lawns.

Message: This is a persistent perennial weed.
ControlMeasure: Requires persistent removal of all root parts. Systemic herbicides may be needed.
Climate: Grows in most climates with moderate rainfall.
AdditionalInfo: Has deep extensive root system making it difficult to control.

Message: This is a common garden weed.
ControlMeasure: Can be removed by hand pulling or hoeing. Mulching helps prevent growth.
AdditionalInfo: Annual weed that can produce several generations in one year.

Message: This is a weed with stinging hairs.
ControlMeasure: Wear gloves to pull manually. Cut before it seeds to prevent spreading.
Climate: Grows in temperate regions with adequate moisture.
AdditionalInfo: Has traditional medicinal uses and can be cooked as a nutritious vegetable.

Message: This is a tropical weed species.
ControlMeasure: Manual removal or herbicide application. Prevent seed dispersal.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as hairy abutilon, it can grow in disturbed areas.

Message: This is a common tropical weed.
ControlMeasure: Hand pulling or herbicide treatment. Regular monitoring needed.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as Indian copperleaf, it has medicinal properties.

Message: This is a woolly weed species.
ControlMeasure: Manual removal or chemical control. Prevent flowering.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as mountain knotgrass, it's drought-resistant.

Message: This is a spiny amaranth weed.
ControlMeasure: Manual removal with gloves. Herbicide application for large infestations.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as spiny pigweed, it has sharp spines on stems.

Message: This is a large milkweed weed.
ControlMeasure: Cut and remove before flowering. Herbicide for established plants.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as giant milkweed, it produces toxic latex.

Message: This is an invasive fruit tree weed.
ControlMeasure: Cut down and treat stump with herbicide. Remove seedlings.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as Indian jujube, it can form dense thickets.

Message: This is a sticky cleome weed.
ControlMeasure: Hand pulling or herbicide application. Prevent seed formation.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as Asian spiderflower, it has sticky glandular hairs.

Message: This is a parasitic dodder weed.
ControlMeasure: Remove infected plants. Herbicide application may be needed.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as dodder, it's a parasitic plant that lacks chlorophyll.

ControlMeasure: Dig out tubers completely. Herbicide with specific nutsedge control.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as purple nutsedge, it's one of the world's worst weeds.

ControlMeasure: Wear gloves to remove. Herbicide application for large areas.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as jimsonweed, it's highly toxic if ingested.

ControlMeasure: Pre-emergent herbicides or manual removal. Maintain dense turf.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as hairy crabgrass, it's an annual grass weed.

ControlMeasure: Herbicide application or manual removal. Prevent seed production.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as jungle rice, it's a major rice field weed.

ControlMeasure: Physical removal or biological control. Prevent spread to new areas.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as water hyacinth, it's a floating aquatic weed.

ControlMeasure: Hand pulling or herbicide application. Mulching helps prevent.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as prostrate spurge, it has milky latex sap.

Message: This is a toxic lantana weed.
ControlMeasure: Cut and treat stump with herbicide. Remove all plant parts.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as wild sage, it's toxic to livestock and invasive.

ControlMeasure: Hand pulling or herbicide application. Prevent seed dispersal.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as devil's claw, it has distinctive seed pods.

ControlMeasure: Cut down and treat stump. Remove seedlings promptly.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as Jerusalem thorn, it has sharp thorns.

AdditionalInfo: Also known as congress grass, it can cause allergic reactions.

AdditionalInfo: Also known as stonebreaker, it has traditional medicinal uses.

ControlMeasure: Hand pulling or hoeing. Mulching helps prevent growth.
Climate: Warm temperate to tropical regions worldwide.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as purslane, it's edible and nutritious.

ControlMeasure: Cut down and treat stump with herbicide. Remove seedlings.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as gum arabic tree, it has sharp thorns.

ControlMeasure: Dig out rhizomes completely. Herbicide application may be needed.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as manyspike flatsedge, it's a perennial sedge.

AdditionalInfo: Also known as rubber vine, it can smother native vegetation.

AdditionalInfo: Also known as wild thyme, it can invade lawns and gardens.

ControlMeasure: Cut down and treat stump. Remove seedlings promptly.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as chromolaena, it can form dense thickets.

ControlMeasure: Herbicide application or manual removal. Prevent seed production.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as broom snakeweed, it's toxic to livestock.

ControlMeasure: Dig out rhizomes completely. Herbicide application for large areas.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as johnsongrass, it's a perennial grass weed.

AdditionalInfo: Also known as dandelion, it has edible leaves and medicinal properties.

ControlMeasure: Hand pulling or herbicide application. Mulching helps prevent.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as horse purslane, it's a prostrate annual weed.

ControlMeasure: Hand pulling or herbicide application. Prevent flowering.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as coatbuttons, it has daisy-like flowers.

ControlMeasure: Hand pulling or herbicide application. Remove before seed formation.
AdditionalInfo: Also known as cocklebur, it has spiny seed pods.
